text: down it's just the smallest incremental move for that specific market that you're looking at whatever however it is priced so tick up means that the market has moved one tick up and it's smallest incremental pricing and when that is also the opposite is true when the market ticks down one tick the market has sold one tick in its smallest possible pricing increments accumulation versus distribution zone so if you notice a buyer between 50 and 54, so every time the market comes down to 50 to 54, someone steps in and buys every price 50, 51, 52, 53, 54, then that's someone that's accumulating, accumulation is generally on the buy side, distribution is on the sell side, so for example the And trades to 65 between 60 and 65 you see a seller come in from 65 to 60 using some particular type of order execution trading strategy type and he just keeps on reselling that range whether it be a time slice order or A volume slice order, which we look at in the absorption module area. Then you can execute a certain type of Order flow pattern once you've spots someone who's accumulating an area or distributing an area You can get it in small time frames and very large timeframes and you could also talk about when someone's sitting on the bid that effectively means that that someone keeps on reloading a buy so the market trades towards 60 so trades from 63 62 61 to 60 the moment it gets to 60 there's a 500 lot that 500 lot gets taken another 500 lot reappears and then it gets taken and another 500 lot reappears at 60 that means someone is reloading the bid, and then you can get the converse, that is true, sitting on the offer where someone just reloads or keeps on. or keeps on stacking that particular price every time the price gets taken.
